title: Sweet Soul Music: Rhythm and Blues and the Southern Dream of Freedom
description: SWEET SOUL MUSIC profiles the legendary artists—among them Sam Cook, Ray Charles, Aretha Franklin, Otis Redding, and Al Green—who merged gospel and rhythm and blues. "The best history of '60s soul music. . . . Sooner or later, it is going to be recognized as a classic; the time to read it is now".—Robert Palmer, NEW YORK TIMES. 175 photos.
author: Peter Guralnick
